description: Add priority levels to the task management app - users can assign high/medium/low priority to tasks, see visual indicators, and filter by priority.

userStories.title: Create Priority type and update Task interface
userStories.description: As a developer, I need TypeScript types for priorities so the codebase has type safety.
acceptanceCriteria: Create Priority type: 'high' | 'medium' | 'low' in src/types/index.ts
Add optional 'priority' field to Task interface with default 'medium'
Export both types from the types barrel file
npm run typecheck passes with no errors
userStories.notes: This is foundational - must be done first

userStories.title: Add priority utilities and constants
userStories.description: As a developer, I need utility functions for working with priorities.
acceptanceCriteria: Create src/utils/priority.ts with:
- PRIORITY_CONFIG object with label, color, and icon for each priority
- getPriorityLabel(priority) function
- getPriorityColor(priority) function returning Tailwind classes
- sortByPriority(tasks) function that sorts high > medium > low
All functions are typed and exported
npm run typecheck passes

userStories.title: Create PriorityBadge component
userStories.description: As a user, I want to see a visual badge indicating task priority.
acceptanceCriteria: Create src/components/PriorityBadge.tsx
Props: priority: Priority, size?: 'sm' | 'md' (default 'md')
Renders colored badge with priority label
Colors: high=red, medium=yellow, low=gray (use Tailwind)
Component is accessible (has aria-label)
npm run typecheck passes
Verify component renders correctly in browser

userStories.title: Create PrioritySelect component
userStories.description: As a user, I want to select a priority when creating or editing a task.
acceptanceCriteria: Create src/components/PrioritySelect.tsx
Props: value: Priority, onChange: (priority: Priority) => void, disabled?: boolean
Renders a styled select dropdown with all priority options
Shows colored indicator for selected priority
Keyboard accessible
npm run typecheck passes
Verify in browser: can change priority selection

userStories.title: Integrate PriorityBadge into TaskCard
userStories.description: As a user, I want to see the priority badge on each task card.
acceptanceCriteria: Update src/components/TaskCard.tsx to show PriorityBadge
Badge appears in top-right corner of card
Tasks without priority default to 'medium'
Existing TaskCard functionality still works
npm run typecheck passes
Verify in browser: badges appear on task cards

userStories.title: Add PrioritySelect to TaskForm
userStories.description: As a user, I want to set priority when creating a new task.
acceptanceCriteria: Update src/components/TaskForm.tsx to include PrioritySelect
Priority field appears after title input
Default priority is 'medium'
Priority is included when form is submitted
npm run typecheck passes
Verify in browser: can create task with priority

userStories.title: Create PriorityFilter component
userStories.description: As a user, I want to filter tasks by priority level.
acceptanceCriteria: Create src/components/PriorityFilter.tsx
Props: value: Priority | 'all', onChange: (filter: Priority | 'all') => void
Shows buttons/tabs for: All, High, Medium, Low
Active filter is visually highlighted
npm run typecheck passes

userStories.title: Integrate filtering into TaskList
userStories.description: As a user, I want to see only tasks matching my selected priority filter.
acceptanceCriteria: Update src/components/TaskList.tsx to use PriorityFilter
Filter component appears above task list
Selecting a filter shows only matching tasks
Filter state uses useState (no persistence needed yet)
Tasks are also sorted by priority within filtered results
npm run typecheck passes
Verify in browser: filtering works correctly

userStories.title: Add unit tests for priority utilities
userStories.description: As a developer, I want tests to ensure priority logic works correctly.
acceptanceCriteria: Create src/utils/priority.test.ts
Test getPriorityLabel returns correct labels
Test getPriorityColor returns correct Tailwind classes
Test sortByPriority sorts correctly (high first, low last)
All tests pass: npm run test

userStories.title: Update README with priority feature documentation
userStories.description: As a developer, I want documentation explaining the priority feature.
acceptanceCriteria: Update README.md with Priority Feature section
Document available components and their props
Include usage examples
Document the utility functions
